heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 28 September 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.1°C) and outside temperature (down 3.5°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 45.2°C), feels like temperature (up 47.1°C), outside temperature (up 47.1°C), and cloud levels (down 153 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 254.9m higher than yesterday, 153.0m higher than the past week, 315.2m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 821m to a maximum of 3400m, averaging 2050m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1896.8m and 1734.6m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
